newsitem.title: USA: Jury finds former U.S. fugitive guilty of rape.
newsitem.headline: Jury finds former U.S. fugitive guilty of rape.

text.p: A jury on Thursday found former fugitive Alex Kelly guilty of raping a 16-year-old girl after a party 11 years ago, an official in the Stamford Superior Court's clerk's office said.
The six-member jury reached its verdict just a day after beginning deliberations in a retrial that began on May 15. Kelly's first trial ended in a hung jury last November.
Kelly, 30, fled the United States in 1987 on the eve of his original scheduled trial and lived as a fugitive for eight years before surrendering in Switzerland in 1995.
He faced a single count of sexual assault, which carries a maximum sentence of 20 years in jail. He had claimed that the sex was consensual.
There was no immediate information on sentencing.
Kelly was also accused of raping a 17-year-old girl in February 1986 in a separate incident, but the two cases are being tried separately. No date has been set for the second trial.
